title: 194 • 9XnpfUr2QXLP
name: Bernhard
location: A peaceful place near the water .
text:
That our decade was not just Internet, social hating or depressed people in case of having to much things. I want us to be remembered as the ones that turned the sail and that started the right steps to the social Utopia where no one have to sleep outside or cant get enough food in lack of money . 
We could built a better World if we use modern technologie not for Business and developing things nobody needs. We should use the knowledge to create New Systems of ways to live. We think democracy is the best. Yeah it is at this time, but just because we cannot imagine it we can create a better System. One that doesnt exist yet. Everyone is saying it's impossible.. i say no... everything is possible .
The meaning of believing in utopia is not to unrealistic. You need unrealistic Visions of future and a maybe dream utopia. Cause when we dont start to believe that there can be a better World we will not take the steps that are needed. Utopia is a funny thing that rises on the Horizon ,but when you go near them, it seems to keep distance to you. But this is just one look at it, cause with every step it leads you to a better World.

title: 254 • xk2hrLFToPt9
name: Molly
text: Justine - she was my best friend from age 18 - 22. I want them to remember the time me and her climbed the roof of her high school in Northern Wisconsin. We sat together of the gravel roof and leaned back to look at the stars, we were so far away from the city you could see the Milky Way. I always felt contented and comfortable in her presence so that is the feeling, we talked about how our bodies are made of the same materials as stars. I always wished I kissed her

title: 272 • s9nqTOmiAVAJ
name: Stine
text: In the middle of the night in the middle of May we come home from a friends party. Our garden lay in complete dark. It was new moon and the stars were bright. Suddenly we heard, in the dark, a bird singing. It was the nightingale. We went down into the dark garden to listen to the nightingale, which we had never heard before. It sounded like there were two responding each other and varying their singing, but it could just have been one having fun and enjoying being the only one singing in the dark. I want the future both to remember and to actually hear both the nightingale and multiple other species making noices through the day and in the night.
